meanings.definition: To remove spiritual qualities or significance from something.
meanings.sent1: The scientist despiritualized the ancient ritual by explaining it scientifically.
meanings.sent2: The modern world often despiritualizes traditional practices.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his morning routine despiritualizes the concept of a sacred ritual.
meanings.sent4: The industrial revolution despiritualized the connection between humans and nature.
meanings.sent5: The harsh reality of war despiritualizes the idea of a higher power watching over us.

meanings.definition: To make something less spiritual or sacred.
meanings.sent1: The new laws despiritualized the religious ceremony, making it more of a formality.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed a character who despiritualized every sacred place he visited.
meanings.sent4: The rise of materialism despiritualized the values of the community.
meanings.sent5: The constant noise of the city despiritualizes the peacefulness of the countryside.
